description:
Walked pass this place when I saw the sign 27$ 3 entrees so I went in and got 3 entrees to go. Such a sweet deal to pass up. 

I ordered chicken in black bean sauce, beef with string beans, and tender greens in garlic sauce. Least favorite was chicken in black bean sauce, I enjoyed the beef with green beans, and the tender greens were decent. 

It's a good cheap eat/casual dine in or take out. I'd come back.
author: Ngoc P.

description:
late dinner, but not too late, this restaurant closes at 9:00p and the kitchen stops taking orders around 8:45p. A very busy restaurant in one of many Chinatowns in San Francisco.  This was off the dinner menu which consist of three dishes for around $27. or single dishes for $11.
Very inexpensive for a restaurant that serves very good food. The only reason the price is more expensive than before is because some people thinking raising your wages would raise your standard of living, not realizing that everything will follow in suit thus leaving you no better off than before, can we all say DUH!, I will need to bring some friends to try out some of their other dishes.
author: Raymond L.

description: Typical Hong Kong style cafe. Don't expect much for the service. Most HK style cafes are known for the bad service and great food. Everything is super cheap but the food here wasn't as great as I expected for HK style cafes. But overall, it wasn't bad.
author: Emily H.

description:
My father used to bring us here all the time when I was younger. They fixed up the place since then. We came in for lunch because they are quick and the food is ok. There was a lot of people for lunch. Their food is also affordable and they also give you hot tea to drink. 

We order ham and egg macaroni, Beef and tripe ramen, and Ham and egg with regular noodles. The waitress looked frazzled because of how busy it was. We called her over and ordered. She repeated my order 3 times. My dad and moms order came but mines didn't. It doesn't take long to make macaroni. When we asked about it, she completely forgot to put my order in. When I finally got my macaroni, it was ok. Maybe I'll come back again when it's not as busy and see if they are like before.
author: Michelle C.

description: Just got my favorite Sweet & Sour Egg Tofu 玉子豆腐, along with salt and pepper fried chicken wings at the only place that makes the Best Sweet & Sour Egg Tofu 玉子豆腐
author: Helen H.

description: Food and service is ok at a good affordable price. 3 star. Maybe next time I'll try other dishes.
author: Christy V.

description:
I came here for lunch with some friends, we were in the mood for some baked spaghetti

First their milk tea sucks I got the one with ice it's plus $1 I thought it'll be great but damn it's so bitter 

Next the baked spaghetti was bad! It didn't have much flavor at all 

My friends did enjoy their meals tho so hence the 2/5

Place seems quite busy too 

I think if you're in this area you might want to walk down the street and get a sandwich or Hawaiian food
author: Chiu H.

description: We had our breakfast here yesterday and it was a great experience. The food was decent and price was reasonable.  We ordered the ham and cheese omelette and the sausage and egg combo and it came with two hot drinks. The food came quick which is a plus. Service was good except we needed to flag down the waitress to placed our order. The downside was they put very less cheese in my omelette. It would be nice to add more cheese so it will make it more creamy. By the way, the coffee and milk tea taste very fresh. Some places serve burn coffee in the morning but this place didn't.
author: Diane T.

description: Came today with my mom and sisters. Tried out the beef stew ramen for $10.50 (so delicious the meat was so tender and flavorful + the broth was good) and we got the $25.99 deal for 3 side dishes: mapo tofu, black bean sauce clams (actually had lots of clams w/meat not just empty shells) & minced beef with spinach. All dishes came within 5-10 minutes within ordering on a super busy Sunday. Service was good and cleanness was great. Quick & Delicious & Authentic Chinese food spot. Would recommend to anyone :) not sure why there is so many poor reviews /:
author: Teyonnna H.

description:
I really like this place. It's one of my go-to restaurants when I want Chinese food. The food is fairly prices and I also like how the food comes out pretty quick all the time. They also give large portions. 

This time, I got the white chicken mushroom in white sauce with rice and the satay beef pan fried noodle. I liked the pan fried noodle dish more. The portion was very large and it was just what I expected from this dish. The beef had a lot of flavor and it even had pineapple pieces in it. For the white chicken mushroom dish, it was my first time ordering it. I've always wanted to try it because it always sounded interested. I don't think I would get it again. I believe maybe it was Alfredo sauce that was just poured over it. It was creamy and milky but just not enough flavor for me. Usually all the dishes are good so I'm not complaining. Just wouldn't order it again.
author: Annie H.

description:
curry was watery and wasnt baked. it was in the baked section. i asked why, server told me they dont bake the curry dishes. THEN WHY WAS IT IN THE BAKED SECTION!?! rice on multiple dishes were a tad dry. If an asian restaurant cant do rice, they automatically lost 2 stars in my book.

milk tea was ok, it wasnt strong enough for me. I like my tea strong. this was more on the sweet chocolate milk side.

on the bright side, food came out fast.
author: Jason C.

description: came on lunar new year when everything else was closed. i swore to myself that I would never come back after witnessing a rat incident several years ago. but i guess desperation brings the worst out of me, and when I'm hungry I would do almost anything. the food is typical of any HK style diner. done expect too much.
author: Long C.

description: Cheap food that tastes good. I liked the curry they serve. Service and cleanliness could be improved. Good place for a quick lunch break. Cash only in 21st century... insane.
author: Mark K.

description:
This is a pleasant HK cafe that I got the pleasure of going to. While I was in Hong Kong, I never got to eat at any of the street stalls that it used to be famous for (they are slowly getting kicked off the streets) so I found it a great experience to try the food in SF. I enjoyed the food thoroughly and I can tell that there are a lot of foreign influences on the food. I got a ham and cheese omelet which was delicious. You'd never think of it as Chinese food.
The service here was alright. My date ordered in Cantonese and we had no trouble at all :) I quite enjoyed the experience here.
author: Jenn T.

description: This place is under rated! The food, portions, and the price are all equal to 4 stars.  Big portions.This is one of the best things about SF,  Chinese restaurant that has good food and good price.
author: Matt L.

description:
8. Ham & Egg Omelette, Hash Browns and Toast with Butter. The Hong Kong style milk tea came with the meal.

Today is my second time coming in for breakfast and the food is delicious. 2546 Cafe is certainly one of the best restaurants to visit for breakfast, lunch or dinner. I like that they have Happy Hour Specials, the food is delicious and affordable. All in all, good food and pricing plus facility cleanliness is bound to keep regulars coming often. I am certainly coming back again!
author: Bennett W.

description:
It is really sucks service I never seen.....

Price is fair. The food taste is on general level but the waitress gave us the attitude all the time.

If you are going to just take a quick meal, it could be fine.... but if you are going to meet your friends or have the gathering in the restaurant, you are better to well prepare to suffer the waitress's attitude.
author: Jerry H.

description: Food is reasonable and tasty.  The place is fixed up nicely.  I was really turned off on the poor serivice.  The two Chinese ladies paid no attention to us and I had to flag them several times for their attention.  They were just plain rude
author: Pedro N.

description: Great place and loved the food. Despite the looks of the restaurant, the food is delicious and would recommend this place for many of people who are looking for a delicious Hong Kong-Style food.
author: Justin L.

description:
Delicious, fresh, and cheap. Have been here a few times already and quality is consistent.
I usually get the salted fish egg plant dish that comes with rice, soup, and milk tea for less than $10. I recommend the salted fish fried rice and spinach with beef and egg white.  Once we got around 8-10 dishes and total cost was around $80. There were no leftovers.
author: Tes Y.

description: No General's chicken?  What the heck?  New owners.  Not as good as it was before.  Sauces seem more generic.
author: Sondra H.

description: Never. Again. Got food poisoning, bad food poisoning. Thirty minutes after I ate there and bruuuh I was dying. My mom, ignorant of the pain and suffering that I was going through and thought that I was just kidding around, ate my leftovers. She's now dying as well. I don't even know how tf this restaurant has been given 5-star reviews by others. The hot milk tea that was given was shit. The food tasted like the disappointment it looked like. That mess that they call a meal was not worth the amount of money we spent and it will probably cost us four more dollars worth of bleach once we eventually vomit all over the goddamn floor. Thank you so much for the disappointment!
author: Yoshi ..

description: Food is awesome, friendly stuff, close to my housee favorite place to get my beef stew
author: Andy A.

description: Great HK style foods! Don't come here expecting it to be all American and you'll be just fine. It's a different culture. HK milk tea, Curry fishballs, baked spaghettis, beef tripe are all VERY good.
author: Calvin K.

description: I came to try their breakfast special up to 11 am but they stopped serving breakfast at 10:50 am. So I went ahead to try their normal lunch menu. The ramen were not fully cooked, spaghetti was dry w/ little minced meat. Milk tea came w/ the spaghetti & it tasted awful. Very disappointing lunch at this restaurant AKA 2546 Cafe
author: Wendy W.

description: I've been coming to this neighborhood cafe at least once a week because the noodles and rice dishes are so yummy. I gotta say, all servers there are friendly and personable. This is my to-go for comfort food.
author: J. Y.

description: This is a nice Chinese restaurant. Pretty affordable with a wide variety of foods. They even have ramen, but that's Japanese. My cousin knows the owner so they are friendly to us. Food taste good. My family usually gets more traditional Chinese food and they do a good job of it.
author: Michael W.

description: Standard HK style cafe, minus the grilled items. Our table got a variety of things, from soups to noodles to fish and we enjoyed it all. I really recommend the cod and corn rice plate but that's just my go-to at cafes and they did it very well here. I like that the food comes out really hot too, so it was perfect for the rainy, cold weather that was going on. Decent prices too, especially the combos that come with a coffee or milk tea.
author: Kathy L.

description: The milk tea is the best I've tasted in california! It tasted like the genuine, crushed ice, old-school street cafe style cheap but original milk tea I used to drink when I was little. Didn't know they were actually available in the states!
author: Henry L.

description: I order the pork chop over rice. The rice was perfect. Rice is most important in Chinese food and the pork was juicy! This place is close to my uncle house.
author: Rong Bing C.

description:
This is a place where a coworker and I have discovered as a good lunch place not too far from the workplace.  We like ordering from the 11am-5pm menu special where we select an entree and it comes with a choice of coffee or milk tea (we like choosing the latter) for $7-something before tax.  Not a bad deal.  The last two times I've come I ordered their ma po tofu and really like how they do it here.

The staff is overall nice and friendly.  For a HK-style cafe I'd say the service here is much better than most similar such places, which is another plus.
author: H K.

description:
A decent cafe restaurant with good food and ambiance in this area!  I was walking around and I couldn't find a good restaurant to grab a light snack before dinner until I stumbled pass this place!  

The area does not have a lot of good dining restaurants, but luckily I found this one!

I like how they have happy hours for food and complimentary milk tea with your orders!  

A good place to chill at in this area!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Juts had a quick lunch here. Despite it being around 4 o' clock, there was a good amount of people inside already, but getting a seat wasn't that hard. We were right on time for the happy hour menu, but alas, there wasn't any options that included something with a hearty side of rice. On to the other menu, I suppose.

We settles on a plate of black pepper beef and spaghetti with an iced coffee (The hot version comes free, but the cold/iced version cost a buck extra) and the pork chop with rice. The iced coffee was a bit too sweet for me and tasted a lot like milk tea. They must have spiked the milk or something. Our food arrived and they looked great! 

Pork chop with onions and rice
- The size took us by surprise. Luckily, we didn't order anything else other than the spaghetti because I doubt we'll be able to finish it. If you've ever had salt and pepper pork chops, imagine that along with a sweet and salty gravy on top. It was decent and the pork chop stayed relatively crisp throughout.

Black pepper beef with spaghetti
- The portion was spot on for the price and tasted alright. You taste more of the veggies that come with it like bell peppers, onion and bean sprouts, but that's to be expected in Chinese restaurant noodle dishes. 

The bill came out to be $15.77 which isn't bad for lunch for two. We were relatively full and left satisfied. Service was rather quick, but the waitress there could smile a bit more. She just gave the entire restaurant a really bad vibe. The male waiter on the other hand was very attentive. I'll be coming back for a quick lunch seeing as the dinner menu is always raising in price.
author: George Z.

description: This had the best noodles I've ever tasted and some really tasty pig feet! I'm not too sure why people gave it such low ratings I honestly think it was delicious.. And I would definitely come here again when I'm in the mood for Chinese food.
author: Dylan C.

description:
I like their lunch set. Price is reasonable. There are a list of dishes you can choose, and it comes with rice, a drink, and soup of the day. 
Satff are friendly too!
author: Edward L.

description:
I second that zero star review if I can give that rating!  Once again after that fake grand opening everyone including the waitress claiming that there's a new owner the bad service and terrible food stay on as usual.
I haven't set foot in this joint for like 2 yrs and the bad attitude of the staff makes me want to run.  But still I gave it yet another try. ooops big mistake.
Food still sucks and yes they got the order wrong.  I want wonton noodle soup not just soup.  And of course they over charge us and not give us the compliment milk tea like I ask.  I don't want to argue and have to make a scene.  No more coming back to this place; its is dead to me.  I rather eat cup noodle then come here again.  All the problems I have before are still here remaining.
author: Lantz G.

description:
This place is close to my house. Parking can always be a challenge but I usually grab my food to go so its not all that bad. Beware of the meter maids though!

I've eaten here about 4 or 5 times. The food is always quick, super hot and very flavorful. The only things is that they only take cash. It is a typical Asian café. I'll be back!
author: Krystal T.

description:
I had been planning to save this restaurant for my 2546th review, but I don't see that happening anytime in the next decade.  This is one of two popular Chinese restaurants in my neighborhood that I have yet to review.  In fact, I hadn't even tried it until this past weekend.

The waitresses talk to you in a rude tone of Cantonese.  It's almost as if they're barking at you.  It must be their training since I encountered two rude waitresses with just one visit.  If you've grown up in San Francisco and eaten at many Chinese restaurants in the City this shouldn't bother you.  In fact, rude waitstaff at Chinese restaurants is often expected.  They speak Mandarin too so I'm certain they can bark at you in Mandarin if you desire.

I ordered my staple dish of Dry Fried Beef Chow Fun.  That's my go-to dish at most Chinese restaurants that I visit for the first time.  I must say that 2546 Café makes a good version with lots of noodles and very little white onion or bean sprouts (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/OS-inNsv-GFH_qrk1_rfDg?select=EccDTMgutqPoyNgSkEI4YQ).  The pool of oil underneath is to be expected since chow fun is normally a greasy dish.  That's why they give you hot tea to wash it all down with.  The beef was a bit chewy even though it seemed to have been tenderized with baking soda.  They must use fairly low grade beef.

All in all with rude service and all, I can now say, "2546?  Been there, done that!"  It cost me less than 6 bucks not including tip so prices are definitely on par if you're in the neighborhood looking for Hong Kong style cheap Chinese food.  Me?  Now that I've tried it I can go back to ignoring this restaurant again.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: I just so pissed off right now.... I ordered through the phone, and I repeat two times to the cashier that the things I want. But still, he gave me the wrong items. I was like, what the .......I would never come back.
author: Gloria Y.

description:
This place is so silly, but SO CHEAP. We came for breakfast after Martin L picked me up from the airport. We didn't want to wait in line at Breakfast At Tiffany's. We probably should have...

You know when you wake up and there's no real food at home so you throw items together and call it breakfast? 

That's this place. For $5 someone will throw items together for you. (eg. spam, white toast, scrambled eggs)
author: Jane N.

description: I live around the neighborhood and came here to ate multiple times. The first time I ate here and thought was pretty good. But it seems like the food quality went down hill every time I went. Majority their foods are pretty blend. However, I do very like their HK style milk tea. This is the only think I will go back for it.
author: Karen X.

description: Decided to try this place out after passing by it a several times, and it was a total disappointment. First impression that the waitresses gave me was awful. They were rude and unsanitary, one of them blew their nose at the counter and didn't even bother washing her hands before going back to work. Anyhow, my friend and I ordered a seafood rice plate and a curry dish that was served to us in less than 10 minutes. And without a doubt, everything was frozen, the seafood dish was all watery and disgusting. The only good thing I had was the red bean ice, but asked the waitress to crush the ice for me and she said she couldn't do that. Although my friend ordered a slushy...? Overall, will not recommend this place and will never come back here again.
author: Kelly Z.

description:
Why is this place called 2546 Cafe?  It should be called "I put too much bean sprouts in your food to make it look bigger cafe".  Went here because the GF wanted to come here since she lives close by.  Maybe I ordered the wrong thing and should have got a rice plate or something.  But regardless, my food was below par- simply substandard.  I ordered the pepper fried udon with chicken with extra bean sprouts apparently.  I dislike asian restaurants that put 75% bean sprouts in your order to create an illusion of a lot of food.  The noodles itself were overly soy sauced, and there was chicken with cartilage and bone.  YUM!  

My girlfriend ordered the macaroni soup with ham.  The funny thing is, they forgot the ham.  So you know what they did?  They just fried a fat slice of ham, and gave it to her on a plate.  How appetizing.  

In my opinion this place should be closed down.  But what do i know.  I am just one person that does not like a bean sprouts.
author: Victor L.

description:
For lunch and dinner, I think 2546 has finally found a decent chef and finally has some good food. Could not say that 1 year ago or even a couple months ago after their remodel. Although prices are a slightly leaning on expensive for HK Style food, baked rice and spaghetti dishes now come with milk tea. Finally had a memorable meal...stir fry prawns with vegetables, tofu with beef, baked mushroom chicken with spaghetti. Food was fresh, piping hot, and delicious. Tables were clean, service...well, what can you expect at these types of chinese cafes. Came a few times already, and food is consistently good.
For FINALLY stepping up their game after so many years of mediocrity, I award them 4 stars.
author: V C.

description: I never really had a problem with this place, except for it being a bit pricy. but then this time they charged 15% of service tax. and the serving wasn't even big enough for it to cost that much. the place wasn't exactly clean either because there were ants crawling near our food.
author: Cindy A.

description: Not sure if I was eating pepper or ants on my bland "spaghetti". Here's a tip- don't eat near the bar counter or the bench, bugs galore. Portions are small also- if you want Chinese food, the $1-$2 Chinese food takeout next to metro pcs is better.
author: Jessica L.

description: I don't know why this place doesn't have better ratings.  I actually enjoy coming here when I want Chinese food.  Their menu covers a wide selection, and everything's so fairly priced!  They have plates where you can choose what meat/dish you want, and they'll serve it over rice.  They also have another option where you can order 3 dishes (of your choice) and it's only like $20.  I usually keep it safe and order things that I know I'll like, such as, beef & tofu, broccoli beef, or pan fried noodles.  Perhaps my experience is better than others, because I never ordered anything adventurous?  Also, I've been coming here for a while now, and they used to serve you a complimentary soup and milk tea with your meal.  I don't think they do that any more, but to be frank, the free soup & milk tea didn't taste good any ways.  If you're judging the restaurant on the free soup & milk tea they used to serve, then you're going to be disappointed; however, if you judge the place for its food, then I think you might actually like it here =]
author: Eric L.

description:
I think I have only dine-in once. It was really crowded at noon, and the service is just okay, nothing particular. I usually get to-go since my boyfriend and I think the restaurant is too noisy, and to-go seems better for us. 

I like their Ice Lemon Tea - but that's like an essential for every Hong Kong  tea cafe, right? It will be the last thing that they would go wrong with it. my recent favorite is the sandwiches, yeah I know I can probably make it at my home, but it's pretty large portion for me. I like it. As for other dishes/plate, I don't have any preferences.
author: Leslie C.

description:
I go to this restaurant whenever I want to eat a cheap Hong Kong style lunch.

I usually come during the later lunch hours because this place gets pretty packed around noontime. When it's packed, the service is slow and not very attentive. For lunch, I like to order their rice dishes because I like drinking the soup that comes with it.

Also, I used to come here during their happy hour which starts at 3pm so I can drink the hot milk tea along with my food.
author: Jenny T.

description: Great HK food! Love the Baked Project Chop over rice! It's my go to place in the area for HK cafe food.
author: Wayne S.

description: we went to eat lunch today, I saw the receipt , they charged us extra 25%. so horrible. SAN FRANCISCO sales tax should be only 8.75%, right？I wont go there again
author: Karman C.

description:
Somehow I never get tired of this place, no matter the time of day, rain or sunshine, this place tends to hit the spot. 

Been loyal customers for 6 years now and it means something when you have loyalty customers. I like to support my neighborhood hotspots bc the food is good, service is great and it's a parking war on San Bruno Avenue. (You only have wars when you know the place is on and poppin). 

Food wise:
*Tomato beef noodles; depends on which chef is cooking, but you have chow mein noodles cooked with beef, onions, bell peppers and tomatoes which makes this dish oh so saucy.

Black Pepper Fried Rice; It's simple fried rice with a zast of black pepper which being the spicy food eater that I am, loves bc it hits the spot. 

Chicken Udon; Udon noodles stir fried with black pepper, bean sprouts, green onions and succulent chicken. 

Tomato Beef Pan Fried Noodles; Just as good as the original tomato beef but with crunchy noodles which has become my ultimate favorite by far. 

Tofu Clay Pot; Tofu cooked with tons of veggies and all sorts of meats so you have little bit of everything. 

Steamed Fish; Can't remember, maybe it was a sea bass or rock cod but steam fish is always on my menu. Mmmmm oh so saucy, tender fish steamed with soy sauce that makes you keep wanting more :)

Fried pork chops & chicken wings; My kids love chicken wings and I love how their lightly battered and fried with jalepenos :)

Meat Sauce Spaghetti; Mmmm I usually tend to choose spaghetti over rice bc well I'm a noodle girl. Saucy, meaty and oh so tasty and served with garlic bread.

Ox Tail; Yep I love meat too just as much as noodles. Their ox tail has become my obsession. Cooked with red wine, sweet and falling off the bone and with a side of their spaghetti it's a winner in my book.

Lastly I'm definitely a groupie for their Hong Kong Style Milktea (cold please). A great way to wash all the good food down; sweet tea and milky. *Ok now I'm craving one!!! :)
author: Anonymous P.

description:
Was hoping to see at least 2546 yelp reviews why I should or should not eat at this place....

Went here because a fellow friend who happens to live in the neighborhood suggested we head over to a restaurant serving both Chinese and Western cuisine. Judging from both exterior and interior of the place, it is relatively clean for a chinese speaking restaurant if you know what I mean. Upon entering the restaurant, my friend and I were seated immediately with menus in front of us. While the selection of dishes are quite numerous, both of us settled down with the western style dishes (to be exact, curry beef stew and curry chicken) which came with garlic bread, soup, and your choice of spaghetti or rice.

The downhill part starts. My friend noticed my side of the table did not have a fork and a napkin. Trying to get a waitress' attention is impossible either because they were either too busy or simply they did not want to acknowledge. Once we got a waitress' attention bringing my lack of eating utensil issue up, the waitress responded with the rude "I know, I KNOW!" and proceeds to continue with whatever she was working on. After a while, I did get my fork and my napkin.

Food came out in huge plates for both my friend and I. While she got her curry beef stew in a stew dish, mine was in a form of a chicken steak with curry sauce over it. I do not recall my dish saying it would come in this form since it only said "curry chicken". Anyway, we went on eating but the food was just so-so. Bland and greasy curry sauce over chicken steak, super sweet red sauce (I think they might have just heat up ketchup with bits of meat) on my spaghetti with 3 bite size pieces of vegetable---I suppose it is alright if you need something to fill your stomach up. Otherwise, I would recommend something else to order.

The "bright" side of this whole thing:
The only thing trying to get the waitress' attention quicker than anything else above was her handing the total bill to us, taking it from us once we plunk down a $20, and giving us our change back.
author: Kim L.

description:
Food is average for a chinese place. Tastes good and is inexpensive. Not much else to say except portion size is decent. 

Our experience here wasn't the greatest because it was cold as eff, but they wouldn't let us close both doors because of ventilation or something. They did allow us to close one of the doors though.

None of the foods stuck out too much for me. Bitter melon chicken was a hit (as it usually is). So were the salt and pepper pork chops. The salt fish with eggplant was a miss and one of the few surviving dishes.
author: Courtney Q.

description:
Looking for a quick dinner and dropped into 2546 Cafe right before closing. I ordered the curry pork chop and ACCCCCCCCCCCKKKK... I get a thin slice of battered pork? NOT EVEN. I felt that I was mainly eating batter, so I had to mix it in with my curry and rice in order for me to fill my stomach. Not enjoyable at all.

No high expectations for their service to begin with, but 1 star sums up my whole experience here.
author: Nancy N.

description:
Took my boyfriends parents here (since his parents wanted to eat here).

This restaurant reminds me of a pho/jollibee. LOL.

Walking to the cafe I felt like I was in China Town. 

The food comes out pretty quick, service is OK, food is OK, price is reasonable.

I got the eggplant salted fish with rice and I think I ate a fish bone. I also tried the pork-chop which tasted good and the Thai noodles which was decent.

Would I come back here again? Maybe not, unless I had too.
author: Maria Gracielle Y.

description:
SLOW Service!
We ordered wonton noodle soup and a black pepper beef fried rice. Both of these tasted really good but the service was a little bad it took a few call to get the waiters attention. I would give this place another try in the future.

Reminder: Tip is already included in the bill so make sure you read your bill before you leave them tip.
author: Peter C.

description: The only thing I like most is that I can eat rice until I am full and only cost $1 per person. The food is okay, but the price is more expensive and less than Chinatown. They like to put pineapple in many dishes and salty. Their custom service is so so. And ONE thing I DISLIKE most is that they only accept CASH! Please bring enough cash before you go in.
author: Daisy C.

description: Come here for breakfast today, the price still ok $5.25 with drink. I'm order persevered vegi w/pork rice noodle soup and hot milk tea. The milk tea is still ok. Something make me surprise was the milk tea have a stopper which is good for driving. Nice! I order to rice noodle soup but they still give me egg noodle. Maybe they just follow the menu didn't help me to change it :(  #### egg noodle #better than I expected###
author: Chrissy C.

description:
It's just ok la as my Asian friends would say. I come here for the convenience, usually get the 3 dish special. Even though i specifically tell them NO MSG, i can still feel it. I usually like the rock cod and tofu claypot. It's a cafe so raise your hand for service!

Nothing wow'ed me.
author: Thomas C.

description:
The food is not bad.  The service is okay.  My favorite dish is the Chicken Steak with mushroom and white sauce.  I always ask for extra sauce.

Parking can be a challenge.
author: anita s.

description:
Horrible service! I mean I don't expect good service here but they were beyond horrible! 

My bf and i came after their breakfast special was over. My bf ordered the club sandwich and an iced milk tea and i ordered porridge and a hot milk tea. The waitress asked if I wanted condensed milk with it and I said yes, not knowing that they charge .35 extra. Not a big deal but it just adds to the horrible experience. Our milk teas came, then my bf's club sandwich came. My porridge NEVER came! I just thought it was taking longer because it's harder to prepare than a sandwich. But nope, they just forgot. When I finally realized they forgot, I was already kind of full from picking off of my bf's plate so I didn't care about the porridge.

I was ready to ask for the check when the waitress finally realized she forgot my order. She and the chef were scrambling around trying to see if there was a extra bowl of porridge lying around until I said "check please". The waitress then said "oh you don't want it anymore?" I said no and she apologized...to the chef! Not to me! I was pissed! 

I can understand that I shouldn't be expecting good service at a place like this, but I did expect an apology at least. I just left without tipping them and now I'm here, venting on yelp. Never again, am I coming back!
author: Maggie D.

description:
Food-- not very good. Prices have been increasing quite often throughout the years. Now, with food prices going up, the food portions have skimmed down. 

Service-- definitely a typical chinese cafe place. They want your money and want you to get out ASAP. So don't expect a smile and a warm welcome when you are dining in. 

The only reason why I still come here is because it's so close to my house and this is the only chinese cafe place around the area.
author: Sappho C.

description: This place is a joke. Came here for breakfast and menu are limited. The most ridiculous thing is that the waitress think I am stupid or something. There is breakfast posting on wall with price but don't indicate days available. So assume it will be 7 days a week. When ordering, she just say look at menu for the days available.
author: Alfred K.

description:
Honest - server told the table next to me that someone dropped a lucky New Year's red envelope with money. Then my mom left her cell phone, and they called one of her contacts to let us know they found the phone. It was just a cheap flip phone, but saved us some trouble. Much appreciated. 5/5

Ox tail red wine dish for about $13 was decent, the best dish out of our meal. Tangy, reasonable portion, carrots tender, beef could have been a little more tender, but flavors were on point.

Peking spareribs my grandma liked because she thought they were tasty and she liked the amount of sauce coating them. I found the dish a tad sweet. But still decent.

Salt and pepper beef spareribs were too salty, avoid this. Salted fish chicken eggplant dish was only so-so, forgettable.

Next time I will try one of their whole chicken dishes, those seemed like a generous portion and fresh.
Overall food 3/5 - but probably one of the best places on this street.

They have two pages of dishes where you can pick three dishes for $24 plus the cost of rice. The dishes were all reasonably portioned. 
Price 4/5

Service was fine for a Chinese place. Plus as I said, I really appreciated their honesty.
5/5

Cash only.
author: B B.

description:
One sentence to summarized: I can cook better food when I was a college freshman.
Detail-wise: I decided to order a white sauce seafood rice (or something like that in Chinese) in the baked dish part of the menu. It was out really quick - then I realize what I got wasn't baked, but hey, maybe I misread something. Maybe it is just fried rice with sauce... But god, the taste!
It is a lump of rice dumped under a lump of white sauce and seafood clearly from the fridge. The rice? It still have the sort of burned piece you would find at the bottom of rice cookers - and it is not good, restaurant quality rice either. The sauce is tasteless. The seafood and the vegetable? The fish is soft and mushy with no taste. The vegetable are pretty much raw - this is not a Western restaurant, and this is not a salad. If it is a white sauce, restaurant cooked it to soft and tenderness, especially if it is something in a bakeware. But here? It is like they just roughly chop the vegetable and then throw it in. No effort at all!  The only thing good was the milk tea.
author: Amy C.

description:
For a Chinese-Cantonese style restaurant, this place is pretty good. Others have mentioned that the service is really fast-- and that is true. It's so fast that the waitress came back to us 3 times to ask if my friend and I were ready to order.

We ordered the 3 course meal for $21.99 and selected scrambled egg and beef, fried flounder, and kung pao chicken. The scrambled egg and beef were really just scrambled egg and beef-- not minced beef and egg-- which is what I was hoping for but I can't blame them for having the correct translation (which is also surprising for a Chinese restaurant :P). The fried flounder was my favorite part of the meal. It was perfectly fried and flavored. The kung pao chicken could have been a bit spicier but I still liked it because it was flavorful (with baby corn, mushrooms, and peanuts). Unfortunately, they didn't offer rice with the 3 course meal-- but getting separate bowls of rice is pretty cheap anyway.

The interior of the restaurant was definitely HK cafe style, which I liked. (I was trying to eat Chinese food after all). They serve free tea and have Chinese music playing faintly in the background. I would definitely come back-- and I probably will soon when I'm craving some Cantonese home-cooking (which I can't make even if I tried).
author: Julie H.

description: The customer service is extremely bad.. Cashier yell at customer, and they have no manner. Food has no tastes but salty, and lots of MSG... Not even one star... Not recommended at all....
author: Kris S.

description:
For a SF area HK-style cafe/restaurant, this is the most horrible one that I've been to, to be honest if the food is good I won't complain about the price. But NO! Yesterday was a hot day so I didn't have much appetite for heavy meal, I just decided to get a club sandwich and an iced cold lemon tea to go, waitress handed me the menu and walked away right after, 5mins later I'm ready to order and she told me sandwiches are time consuming to make at this hour so I can't order it (seriously...?) then I ordered just a simple egg and spam rice plate to go then she won't take my order but to make me walk up to the cashier to place my order instead and I got sent back to 'have a seat' at the table...

Conclusion: Drinks were horrible and not properly mixed well, rice plate was not being done right, items on menu are cooked-to-order-based-on-if-they-feel-like-it, service...TWO THUMBS DOWN!!
author: SK Y.

description: A group of my co-workers had wanted to eat somewhere after work for lunch and somebody suggested we go here. Walking in, it feels like a restaurant in Chinatown. Tables are wobbly and walls & tables are dingy. Food was pretty greasy and had lots of msg. Everything we tried was quite mediocre. Since there are several other establishments nearby with better food, I'd recommend going elsewhere.
author: Kitty K.

description: I like coming here because it's close to my house! I came here during lunch and got the spaghetti, and it was soooo goood! I left this cafe with a full stomach! I also came here during dinner once with a couple of friends and I got the three meals for 20$. I thought they'd give you free rice since most resturants do, but its a dollar a bowl so  I shared it with my friends. Other than that, great service and good foood :)))
author: Sandy C.

description:
Really only 1 reason to come here: if you are like me and desperately need a HK cafe fix and this place is the only one for miles and it's late and you are really hungry and so you say let's go for it.

Service is friendly but can be spotty. Food service is slow and erratic. For example my meal comes with soup and garlic bread, and I receive my garlic bread with my entree instead of with my soup. Poor table next to us - waiter never entered their order in the computer and after waiting like 20 minutes, another waiter realized it and came over to ask them to re-order (He was nice and apologetic but still....)

Got some basic HK food like curry beef stew, rock cod with corn sauce, baked pork chop with rice and beef chow fun. Lot's of greasy food. Uninspired but a tad better than my last visit (1 year ago). However if you have the time, better to drive to the sunset or chinatown.
author: Dom L.

description:
Pro:

-I like this place because they have the latest Chinese music. 

-Price is reasonable. To some people it can be consider cheap.

- My opinion about this place is the best Chinese restaurant on San Bruno ave. 

-One of the cleanest restaurant

-A lot of selections
author: Michael Q.

description:
I like this place. They offer a $19.99 Dinner Special where you'd pick 3 items. Plenty of food, in fact too much for 2 people where we had left overs for days.

We like to order the single plate items.  They serve either over rice or with speghetti.  I really like the speghetti, is delicious!  I've tried the fried rice and fried noodles and also pretty good. Also the mango smoothie is good too.

Plenty of items on the menu to try, at very very  reasonable prices.  I will return soon to try more items or maybe even breakfast.
author: Eric D.

description: Never had a problem with this place until today. Always get the salt and pepper fish and it's always pretty good. Today tried to order that and the lady said back to me salt and pepper shrimp. I corrected her and said salt and pepper fish. Picked up my order with no issues (although they only take cash which is a bummer). Got back to my job and saw that she had given me salt and pepper fish. I called to ask if I could come back and get it switched. She just kept saying she was sorry... and then there would be a long silence. I told her I was allergic to shrimp and then she offered to let me come back tomorrow to get the fish. Ummm so what should I do about today's lunch? Make sure they understand your order or double check when you get there... Friend ate the shrimp and said it wasn't even good.
author: Marcelle C.

description: Last time I reviewed it, this place was a joke. Now, it doesn't even deserved to be called a joke. I go there for a simple dinner to give it a second chance, it flopped, again. Seriously, who charges an extra dollar for cheap filet of sole? Rude waiters are now apparently a new addition. Thanks for the horrendous service.
author: Richard L.

description:
I honestly do not understand how the place has so many people eating there.  They have the RUDEST staff members than any restaurant I have gone to.  Today we went around 11am and when we went in we stood there for a while and the guy just points at a table and basically throws the menu at us.  

We then sit there for literally 10+ minutes very bored and hungry.  What got us so ticked off was they were clearing out tables vs. helping us and then to top it off they helped another couple that came in AFTER US.  We just left after that.  

Now I have had bad service but this obviously tops the list.  I was so mad that I have sworn off ever eating there AGAIN!  And on top of it, the food IS NOT CHEAP we have had GOOD and CHEAP off in the sunset and heck anywhere else.  I've eaten here before and the food is not that great.  It was okay but that was a few years ago.  This place has gone downhill real fast.  They must be treating their workers like shit or pay them $5/hr because they obviously hate their customers and if you come in that means they have to work.  On top of it, their breakfast food that has 'orange' juice that I had ordered a few years ago was SUNNY D.  

So if you: LIKE BAD SERVICE, BEING YELLED AT AND IGNORED COME HERE!  Their food isn't any better either.  And I for one will NOT be treated like dirt and pay for it either.
author: Eating And Living Well U.

description: Their service is not bad considering how much I come. I normally come in for coffee with tea but when I dine in, I order the ox tail over rice, beef with broccoli ho-fun or macaroni with spam and eggs. Fast service and the food arrives fast is why I continue to dine there. I don't get why others are giving them such low ratings. Stop the hating, it's a cafe, so lower your expectations.
author: Peter P.

description: Order to go chicken wings and fries ($4.75) Just two small pieces of wings and 10 tiny thin oily potato fries. They charged me extra for hot milk tea $3 instead $1.75 in the menu. Wait for 30 min. Taste are nothing special better taste doing at home. Overpriced, bad service and not tasty.
author: robert l.

description: My friend introduced me this restaurant two years ago. The tastes of the food there are relatively good, yet the service is somewhat awful. The waitresses there are always presenting poker faces and not very attending that one often has to walk to the cashier to ask for the bill. In addition, they charge you extra for dinner because they don't assume you will give more tips for dinner -- as explained by my friend. Better to dine there at lunch time!
author: Hazel H.

description: So my husband went there to get some fried rice to go. The waitress at the counter asked my hubby very impolitely. Knowing her English is bad. But don't need to be rude to a foreign customer.
author: Annie L. L.

description:
I really wish the place was slightly better...either in prices or service.

Came here most recently due to lack of willingness to cook dinner.  We ordered a Thai Chicken with Rice and a fried rice.  The fried rice came out really quickly - within 5 minutes actually. Made me wonder when they made the rice...or maybe the chef was super ready to cook that. Too bad, as the Thai Chicken took about half an hour to come out. And the server didn't mention it to us. Nor is it written that it takes THAT long to make the Thai Chicken.

What is a Thai Chicken with Rice? I didn't know either...until I ordered it. Turns out its a breaded curry chicken with Thai sweet chili dipping sauce. I liked the crispiness of it, but overall it wasn't worth the wait. Or, perhaps, its cause I filled up on the fried rice and wasn't feeling hungry any more.

So as we waited, several more people came into the restaurant.  I saw two tables get their entire order while I waited for this chicken. Again, probably why I was expecting this dish to be off the hook...and it wasn't.

Price-wise, its not too bad. But still a couple dollars too expensive for the quality of food and service you get.  I did the math on the 3 entrees and soup deal. Unless you're dining as 2 people (because rice is $1 per person), its not really worth it. As 2 people, it'll be about $7 per person. And since the portions aren't big, 3 people can't dine in a satisfactory manner.

Come here if you're just looking to sit forever and order very little food.  Otherwise...go somewhere else. Any where else.
author: Lily W.

description: WORST service ever. Slow and they have no manners at all . First time they messed up my order and tried to blame me that I ordered wrong . Tried to go back today and they seated my bf and I next to another couple w felt cramped so we asked to be seated at another open table ( noted ; it was not busy ) the lady said no in a rude why and walked away complaining . This place sucks bad the food isn't good I wouldn't come back .
author: Tiffany K.

description: The red bean drink has no flavor, it was mainly just milk and some red bean. It is not even sweet at all. Won ton noodle soup also have no flavor. The curry rice and curry fish ball noodle are not spicy even though on the menu says it is. The only thing that I like from this restaurant are the fries but they are expensive. I rather go across the street to get fries at Tea Plus.
author: Andy R.

description:
If I could I would give it a negative star! I came to this place a few times, which means I gave them chances to redeem themselves! 

The service was horrible! They are constantly chatting behind the counter and have some kinda attitude problem like they are the shit. It just irritates the shit outta me because that shows that this place has poor customer service!

I recently came here with my mom and sister and they were so damn rude to us! We ordered 2 red bean drinks, 1 hk milk tea, chicken wings with fries, and pan fried noodles with chicken. The red bean was only the good thing of our whole meal! The lady was so stingy on the ketchup, she gave like 1/4 of those small little plastic cups. 5 dips max and the ketchup is gone!

When it came to the check, we literally had to ask THREE times because they kept saying it's coming, it's coming. And this place was not even packed or anything. LAME. If this wasn't a block away from my house I would never step foot in here again!!
author: Alice Z.

description: This place sucks.  Food is bland, portions are small and parking up and down San Bruno ave is the worst!
author: Tony K.

description:
Slow service.  Bad waiters. Nasty food. 

This place is like a downgraded D&A or ABC Cafe. I came here a few times and every time, the food always takes really long to come and the servers don't ever seem like they want to work there because they don't smile at all. Bad experience overall!! This place sucks!
author: Daniel L.

description: Standard HK style cafe. Quick and hot food. Very friendly staff, especially if you speak Cantonese.
author: Angela Y.

description:
I been here twice only and the food isn't that bad. It really depends on WHAT YOU ORDER. Their menu is too big for their own good, way too inconsistent. Their service is terrible. They're really strict about their seating and they don't really care about their customers. You'll see a lot of families eating at this restaurant because they don't go other places or something. The prices are around $5-$9 for entrees, not that bad.

My friend got the teriyaki chicken last time and all it had was plain white rice and some dry ass looking chicken with a drizzle of teriyaki sauce. Drizzle meaning they were putting sauce on it and they stopped 1/3rd way through and just were like whatever. It was not worth the $8.25. I got the black bean sauce on flat noodles and it wasn't that bad and it was way cheaper than the teriyaki chicken.

When I was eating here they let the lion dancers come in and danced around our food and they even let them put fireworks in the front and all the smoke came in and that shit stank. I took it home instead. 1 star just for that experience.
If you eat out a lot you would not want to come (back) here.
author: Hui L.

description:
OK I see lots of yelper complains about the service.
My BF loves this place despite my protest.
He said this place got the ambiance.
NOT, if you call Kareoke video ambiance.
Take it that lots of family and kids comes here and you feel like you are eatting among families.
Now the food is something to complain about.
Its actually not bad but over price if you consider the amount that you receives, where's the beef???
I ate my wonton in 5 sec and usually am a very slow eater and I was hungry afterward.  There's only 5 wonton and the soup was the instant powder kind with msg.  I swear its not worth $5.50.
That makes $1 per wonton.
I have tried their seafood pan fried noodle around $8 was a generous size and lots of seafood the first time and then the second time I order it was smaller and lacking seafood.  
  
Slow, uneven service.  At some point attentively  pour water for you and then forget that you need  the bill while I stares at my friend.  I can't wait to get out of there.
I need to say that in respect to the waitress they are not as rude as some might think it but the place gives off bad vibe. I don't know what it  is and can't put my fingers on it.  The workers there do stares at each other like they want to fight or something like that.
Usually there's lots of people eating inside so business can't be that bad.
author: Mar H.

description: If I can give negative star, I would for this place. Despite I live in the neighborhood, I only dine here for couple of times and never went back. I tried their pork chop rice, breakfast special spaghetti and some other dishes that I couldn't remember. I don't really know how to cook but I think I'll cook better then their food. Service was really slow we had to constantly wave our hands to get attention. I would rather drive further than dine here.
author: Y Y.

description: i had sweet and sour pork and it was delicious! the soup that came with the meal was delicious as well! although i think their service could be better haha...but authentic Chinese restaurants don't seem to be known for having good service anyways....;p
author: Ru C.

description:
Slow. Slow. Slow. 

Last time I came here with my family, our drinks finally came when we were almost done with our meal. Wtheck......

The food is like any other decent hk styled cafe. Save your money and time and go to ABC or somethin'.
author: Judith L.

description:
Had the porridge here. It was hot, but the chicken and mushroom were freezing cold, literally. The employees use the restroom and do not close the door. Very unsanitary and unappealing. 

When ordering the 3 entree deal, the clam dish lacks clams- there's mostly shells. And the portion are VERY small.
author: Priscilla P.

description: This place sucks monkey balls, never eat here, worst customer service everrrr, it makes u pay extra tips there.
author: Maria L.

description:
Service was fine. I wouldn't say its slow or fast. You just have to make sure your looking at them to get there attention. 

Food was good. Things you can buy at the 99cent store. Like spam, eggs, and some macaroni. I had the Beef and Egg macaroni. My friend had this spaghetti that looked pretty good.  He seemed to enjoy it with a passion too. 

If you go there at 2:30 its happy hour. Get a meal and your choice of Milk Tea or Coffee for around $5. 

A good place to come with your friends to chill and eat simple food. Staff was fine to me. They were nice.
author: Chris L.

description:
This place is pretty good. When I go there I normally get the 3 dishes for 19.99 or something like that special. It's good, not amazing. But if you're hungry and looking for reasonably priced food, it's a great place to go.

The service is okay. They're pretty nice, but not that great. It can be really slow sometimes. They look at non-chinese people funny sometimes, but since my family goes there regularly, it's fine.  I just go because it's really close to my house. 

Apparently, they have breakfast specials. I've never gone there for breakfast, but my mom went once. She likes how they give you soup before you're meal. She normally only orders porridge for breakfast if she goes though.
author: Breniel L.

description: Prices are reasonable. Food OK.  Customer service is fast and efficient. I tried pork porridge with preserve egg. It was pretty cheap and well made. It tasted fresh and the porridge had the right consistency (not lumpy or watery).  A good porridge is made from scratch and takes a long time to make. You simply do not make porridge by mixing water and rice, this results in only in making rice soup. I also tried their American sandwiches (BLT). It was fresh and well made. It came with their thin cut and crispy fries. I believe this place is better than what most people on yelp say. It deserves more than the" two star rating of death".
author: Hiroshi K.

description:
So I've heard from undisclosed sources that this place is pretty dirty back in the kitchen (but aren't all Chinese places hehe).  This place is not really good compared to some hk cafes in Chinatown.  I think the first time I came here with a friend.  He got his food right away and I waited for a really long time.  By the time I asked the waiter where my food was he couldn't even remember that I had ordered anything (so what was he doing when I was telling him my order, who knows??)  So we paid and I just left still super hungry.  I finally went back again and the service was ok but the food was quite mediocre.

Pros: cheap food (but you get what you pay for).

Cons: bad service and mediocre Chinese food.
author: Amy C.

description: It was horrible. When we came into the restaurant, we had to find seats by ourselves, and it wasn't even crowded. Then we forgot to pay for the time meter. So, we went to the cashier to trade some money for some quarters to pay the time meter. But she said that she didn't have any. We were disappointed. When we turned around, she reached to a drawer with rolls of coins. So we asked again, for only 4 quarters, but again, she said she didn't have any. When we asked the third time with only 2 quarters, she also said no. We were so disappointed. For a restaurant, you need to be honest, and they weren't. We will not come to that old, dumpy, place ever again.
author: S Z.

description:
I usually come here for dinner when my parents are too tired to cook. I think this place is pretty good compared to all the other Chinese restaurants around the area. I come here often but I also gave the other Chinese restaurants a try, their dishes just aren't as good as San Bruno Cafe. 

3 dishes for $19.99 is a pretty good deal to me. I think it's $1 for rice per person. I recommend the salty fish seasoned eggplant & chicken claypot (or substitute with tofu) and the cod fish with green string bean.

The service I received wasn't as bad as other reviews. I don't expect grand service from this place bc it is a hongkong CAFE type place, not your typical restaurant. However, I only come here for dinner so I can't speak for the service during the other times of the day.
author: Thomas Y.

description: -_- service here sucks ass!!! Whenever I come here with my friends, just because its close, the workers are terrible... -_- hella mean and stuck up.. and rude!!! Well it depends because the last time i went there was a nice lady... but the other days... they rude!!!! Their food is somewhat good though, really depends on whatchu get. I would love to share what I got but I forgot... but it has chicken with rice and the rice is yellow with mushroom white sauce over it! :) I always get that...
author: Tiffany T.

description: Women waitstaff was incredibly rude!Everyone who was seated after us received their orders before we did and 4 out of 5 ordered the same thing! When we received our food it was after we reminded them twice our orders were not complete. They gave us the wrong check twice. After letting them know the first time, and witnessing them accuse the waiter for giving us the wrong bill, we just paid. Upon receiving our change, we noticed they gave us the correct bill and change, but the waitress never said anything and acted as if we did not want to pay our bill; she just slammed our change down. I had to restrain my mom from chewing the rude lady out. Never again will we go there! My 9 year old felt even $1 was too much for a tip.
author: ann t.

description: Come here a lot when we want something quick. Normally when price are cheap/affordable I normally try not to complain. Waited for a few minutes, the waitress saw us but kept talking to this one male customer so we decided to just grab our own table since there's empty ones.  Sat there for almost 10 mins the slutty waitress still talking w/the male customer & doesn't look like she's coming our way anytime soon.  I mean this happened a lot on the other times while we were here.  Normally she would put in our order first but not this time. So we headed to #1 phone across the street instead.
author: yan r.

description:
Hong Kong Style Cafe that sits in close proximity to my home. 

The food is bland. The service (or rather lack thereof) is bad. Honestly, if this restaurant weren't located sooooo close to me, I would NEVER come here. They have a morning special that consists of an omelette, a soggy hash brown and a slice of buttered white toast; it comes at a decent price and when paired with a cup of their mediocre hot milk tea, I have a quick breakfast to help jump start my metabolism.

Just don't come here if you are looking for quality cause you won't find it. 

Side note: Why does Firefox think I spelled 'omelette' wrong? Perhaps, Firefox has not worked the 'omelette' into their system yet. Huh.
author: Maggie H.

description:
All I can say about this place is EPIC FAIL.  They have the worse service I've seen in ages.  I once was eating there with my buddies and we all requested for water, the waiter topped off everyone's cup and not mine.  What is that about?  He didn't say anything and just left.  After that, I swore to never go back there again and I kept that promise

It is not a single incident because my parents ate there too and they waited 30 minutes without any service.  Stay far from this place, I only gave it a 2 because it is Asian owned and I am Asian too.
author: Sam O.

description:
The only reason you would want to come to this place is because of its prices, which by the way, used to be cheaper. 

I came by today because it was close to home, and my friend and I needed a quick and cheap place to catch breakfast. This wasn't my first visit; I've been here when it first opened, a coupon times a while after it opened, and today. One word: downhill. 

Food: $3.80 breakfast- porridge, chow mein and orange juice. 
 - Porridge was basically white water. 
 - Chow mein was full of MSG (you can tell when you take one bite and you get insanely thirsty), but because there is a ton of MSG, it didn't taste too bad. 
 - Orange juice- was not OJ, like cheap orange soda.

Service: Rude. 
- Every time I talked to the waitress (twice), she left midway in my sentence, either telling me to hold on or assuming she knew what I wanted (hence, the second time I had to call her back). 

Ambiance: decent- they have a flat screen TV where they usually play concerts of Hong Kong singers, which I like (but not enough to come to this place to eat). 

I do admit though, that I am a little biased because I know they could do better. When they first opened, it was such a great addition to the community because of the cheap(er) prices, good food quality and fast/attentive service. I'm pretty disappointed about how this restaurant is ending up.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I swore that I'd never come back here again. I used to come quite often with my mom to have a simple meal or a nice breakfast but after one of my experiences with a friend I won't be returning. We sat down for a dinner and ordered simple dishes that shouldn't have taken too long to prepare. After a while of waiting the waitress gave us some garlic bread (too crunchy/hard for my taste) after a while longer we asked to check up on our order. The waitress apologized for the wait and brought us some soup. We ended up waiting a total of 45 minutes (I don't even know why we stayed that long) and never got our food. This was after asking the waitress to check on our order 3-4 times. We promptly stood up and left. The food was never that good anyway.
author: Sannie L.

description: Just not worth it. I don't care if it's "decent' food here, I'd rather take the bus or drive to another district for better food. I came here twice with my dad and the food was below standards to me. The second and last time I came here, they completely missed the order -__- its just my dad and I, sitting next to the register where the server should have clearly saw that only my dad was eating for about 10 minutes. No one thought to check on my food. And no, it wasn't even crowded.... they didn't even apologize for the mistake, just went on with it as if the chef took a long time to cook it, but even then, they should still say something....
author: Connie C.

description: 2 dishes for $19.99 not bad at all... the food was just ok, didn't really blew me away, your typical abc and dna fast food :P would i come back sure why not but what is the chance...
author: JessePanda C.

description: Expensive , small portion , however a good spot to sit down and eat so I can't complain about that. Would not recommend the 3 dishes because the math tells me it's not that a steal. A lunch special got it done for me , and include soup
author: Jared Z.

description: San Bruno Cafe is the exact same place as 2546 Cafe with the same owners and some of the exact same staffs who works there since day one.  You should read the reviews for 2546 Cafe before going to this place.
author: Z Z.

description:
2nd choice for SUPER cheap chinese food. they have the 3 entree special for under 20 bucks. Really good deal. (second to D&A) This is the closest decent place to my house, so the extra 5 bucks is fine. 

True, its dirty. True, service isnt great. True its kinda oily. etc etc etc. Its a divey Hk restaurant in a okay part of town giving you a lot of food for cheap. I mean its no gary danko so no 5 stars, but the food taste fine and Ill go back for more.
author: Roy L.

description:
D: where do you wanna go?
Me: I dunno...
D: that place on San Bruno?
Me: 87654321?
D: yah that one.. 
Me: shrug* sure i guess.. but you're driving..

at the restaurant: 

*wave
*wave
are you done chit chatting amongst yourselves...?
*wave
*flails arms around.. 
please stop: a) chillin and drinking your iced tea and b) staring at the water-damaged ceiling, and bright sunshine yellow walls... 
helloooo? it's not a big place.. there's only so much to look at.. now why don't you pay attention to at least 1 of the 5 tables seated...

waitress finally notices us, and comes over to prop herself up, palms flat on the surface of our table, to take our order.... uh hella rude.. 

They have a special that's 3 dishes for 16ish.. with a lot to choose from, and they also sell those dishes separately.  we chose 1 from that selection and two other items for more starchy filling .. they just add more $ for the entree, but she replies in a snippy tone.. "well, that's not part of the special"... er.. yeah.. we noticed... 

At least the food came out fast. We ordered the Fook Kin Fried Rice (which every abc kid has dubbed "fuckin fried rice"), Chicken w/ Black Pepper Fried Udon, and Bitter Melon with Cod in Black Bean Sauce. Nothing to rave about, but it's tasty enough to go from 0 stars to 2 stars.. Maybe she's pms-ing or something too.. I sure was...
author: Donna H.

description: The only reason why I'm giving this place any stars is because their food is actually pretty good. BUT their service is HORRIBLE. That's the only reason why my friends & I don't go here anymore .. I miss the food but not even their food could get me to come back here .....
author: Queenie L.

description: I agree with all the bad reviews about the poor customer service.  We came in before 2 other parties and the 2 other parties placed their orders before us.  I have a hypothesis that if you don't speak Chinese, you will get poor service.  We also waited a long time before our food came, then another 10-15 mins just to get our bill.  We had to wave our hands just to get the bill.  Food was alright, but felt sleepy afterwards.
author: James C.

description:
I came here with my coworkers Anthony and Aaron 2 weeks ago, food is still fresh in my mind YO:

1) Eggplant with salt fish and bamboo and pepper $5.95: This exceeded expectations, * * * *. Eggplant was not too oily, but I did like the size that it was cut in, not too thin, not too thick. Each was sliced diagnonally with about an inch in width. The bamboo was shreeded in small bits and the salt fish were bits and pieces spread throughout the dish. For you canto people, salt fish is the salt fish in "ham yu gai lup fan."

2) Black bean red peppered chicken with onions. * * *  stars. $5.95

3) Mongolian beef, with big green onions and scallopped onions. * * * * beef was very tender, with no tendons, and excellently flavored. $5.95

I was not thirsty after eating here even 2 hours after. Good sign of MSG lacking in the food. The place is sort of run down; they do have a flat screen TV though. However, for the price and the dish, it is 4 star quality, and I'd definitely come here again. THIS PLACE IS A " cha chan teng."
author: Brian C.

description:
As everyone else has mentioned, it's a HK-style cafe with an extensive menu.  At lunch, they have $4.95 rice plates that are ginormous in portion.  I'd have given them a three, but I've removed a star due to poor service.  

I went with my dad - we both ordered from the same menu.  He ordered the Bitter Melon with Beef, and I ordered the Black Bean Cod.  The food was decent, but my Black Bean Cod came out quite a bit later.  In fact, had I not told him to start without me, it would have gone cold.  Had he not stopped eating, he'd have been done before I even saw my dish.  

When the food was actually on the table, it was good.  When it came time to getting a check, the service was nice and speedy.  Got my bill almost right away, but didn't get my change for another bit of wait time.  Apparently someone had made the change and just left it there, so we were left waiting for a few minutes before someone else asked around about why there was money sitting on the register...  *EHHEM*  I was probably being inpatient though.  We had 45 minutes on the meter, and despite the slowness of the service, still beat the meter.

1st Star - Great prices.
2nd Star - Decent food.  Many choices.

Would have been 3 Stars.  We still come here on occasion, and I must commend them on accommodating a party of 10+ for us a few times.
author: Tinna H.

description: Very limited selection on breakfast menu.  Cozy environment with flat screen TV, parking spots are available on street. Average food with average price.
author: Al S.

description:
clean place. with row of tables riveted together. there are also some standalone tables/chairs. one flatscreen

menu: hong kong cafe
entree: happy hour special 2:30-5:30 beef stew noodle soup (3.75) with comped tea or coffee.

-coffee-pretty awful stuff, half/half etc cured that
-beef stew noodle soup: 2 pieces bok choy and 3 pieces semi tender beef brisket with some braised noodle in a msg soup.  everything ok except for the soup.

pros
-almost cheap

cons
-had to ask for check, no coffee refill  i.e no service. 10 minutes for the food to arrive.

rating for this one meal only, ymmv
author: Victor G.

description:
I had Take Out only so I can't comment on the service.
Friends from work were going to pick up some Chinese food so I decided to order.  They had so much to chose from on their menu. 
I always try to look for this special an old friend of mine always ordered. ( Chicken, Green Beans, and Egg whites) No luck at this place and they were not able to create it for me here. I just  ordered the Chicken with String Beans. It was really good, I was surprised and no MSG because I didn't feel the side effect or feel super thirsty. I have had this at other Chinese Restaurants and it is always okay. This one was the best I have had. It was also super cheap!
The two mountains of white rice did make the chicken and string beans look like a small serving but it was enough to keep me full. It was also nice and hot.
I would order from this place again.
author: Norma Denisse S.

description:
Came here with the fam Saturday night for some cheap eats. 

We decided to go for the 3-entree deal for $18.99. There's quite a lot of dishes to select from. We went with the Mixed Veggies with Shrimp, Chicken with Green Beans, and Sauteed Garlic Spinach (these are my English translations of the menu items). 

Definitely, you get what you pay for. For me, the best dish of the night was the Sauteed Garlic Spinach. It was piping hot and that's the way the Chinese like to handle business! It's a simple dish that was salted just right with the right amount of chopped garlic. The other two dishes were okay. The shrimp dish had too much gravy sauce over it, and I wasn't fond of the rice wine taste when eating the chicken dish. 

Unlike my fellow Yelpers, I found the service to be relatively decent. They were pretty courteous when they took our order and asked nicely if we needed boxes for our leftovers. 

2546 Cafe is a convenient and cheap place to go for all the Chinese people living in the Portola or Excelsior that don't want to drive all the way to Sunset, Richmond or Chinatown for food.
author: Diana C.

description: Just another HK cafe. Quality is not that great, but it is cheap to get a meal here, and close to home.
author: Jonas T.

description:
It's a run-of-the-mill cheap eats Chinese restaurant placed right smack in a shady community.  This is the type of place you would see in Chinatown, not so much in Bayshore.  Chinese restaurants in Bayshore tend to look...rode hard.  Like some guy sneezed and out came a Chinese restaurant booger.

2546 looks inviting enough although when it comes to food and service, you feel like you got kick in the groin because your girlfriend just found out you slept with her BFF.

The food is mediocre, something you can probably make yourself at home...If you know how to cook, that is.  The menu is basically typical "Fhan Hup" Lunch Box food.  Nothing special.  The main entrees consist of a main meal (whether it be chicken curry, short ribs, etc.) and a choice of spaghetti or rice, or something like that.  Last time I went there I got the short ribs with the spaghetti, it was all right, I've had better from home meals.

The staff never really noticed me coming in being that I seated myself after standing for a bit.  The waiters didn't acknowledge me until I had to call her over, that of course didn't phase her at all at trying to ignore me while taking my order.  It was like she was zoning out on me but at the same time her pen was writing down exactly what I wanted.

Look, if you live in the area, go eat there if you're desperately hungry.  Otherwise, what the hell are you doing in Bayshore?

P.S. Never name your restaurant/store after numbers, no one remembers it...ever.  Especially if it's 4 or more digits.
author: Simon L.

description:
Okkkkk welll soo i asked for a four season peas with chicken over rice... and i dont noe what the heck kinda chicken they gave me! it was hellla nasty..... it was allll like falling apart.. that is not how i like my chicken.. D&A makes the exact same order wayyy better for a cheaper price! and the wait was quite long.. we were seated their the bathroom squished between a couple of tables.... the seating arrangement is very crowded!! i strongly stress to not come here -_- but if you cant help it.. be wise of your food choices..

-x3 shells
author: Lily X.

description:
Another HK Cafe.
I just ate here and caught their breakfast specials.
I ordered the:
Chicken Cheese Omlette - consist of onions(too raw for me), tomatoes and chicken thigh meat, slightly marinated.  I love thighs, but not in my burritos or omlettes

Milk tea (2) - not bad

Toast that wasn't really toasted.

Pork and Egg juk - it's actually pretty good!!  lots of ginger though

Noodles that come with the juk, no meat, pretty tasty

ALL FOR $6.84 with tax.

Clean place, LCD's, fresh juices (but only listed in Chinese) non sticky tables or chairs.  Plus, I had leftovers.  Like hong kong, this is the typical type of service that you would expect.  If you don't call for them, they don't come by you.

stinky tofu
author: StinkyTofu S.

description: this place isn't bad. the food here is cheap and affordable. i like the noodles here. the fried rice is okay too. the dishes and rice plates i'm not so fond of. the service is okay.. i come here sometimes because it's close to my house, happy hour is cheap, i think it starts at 2? i don't remember.
author: Bailey L.

description:
Horrible service. They came late with our friends food, after asking for it a couple of times, and had brought it out AFTER we asked for the bill. We obviously didn't want it anymore and I actually had to argue with them to take it off the bill. 

Once, we saw them put un-eaten rice [from the rice tub that was served to a customer] back into the cooker.

ICK.
author: Adria P.

description: I came here again today . We ordered some different things . The food was just alright .
author: Eileen L.

description:
The reason I join Yelp is because I want to share with everyone how TERRIBLE 2546's service is....

2546 is one of the worst restaurant that I have ever been. They started business about several years back taking over a Thai restaurant and I wish this has never happen because the Thai place was very elegant. I've been into this place several times because I live close by. Service was horrible and this is the reason I tell myself not to go back again. The last time I was there is about a year ago and I decided to give it another try this time and they continue to treat their customer like crap! Yes! This is their service! 

Price is reasonable and the food is ok, I would definitely give compliment to the chefs. Go there if you want to pay to be treated like you are nobody. The one star I gave is for the quality of the food. 

Other options around this area: Red House Bakery (much smaller menu but friendly people), #1 Chicken Pho (Vietnamese restaurant).
author: Harry L.

description: Fast service. Quite a busy place on weekends. Food was good and filling.
author: Daniel W.

description: Service was beyond terrible. Didn't acknowledge us to be seated and didn't provide menu until I was pissed enough to confront the "waitress." I should've went to the bomb ass El Farolito mexican food right next store.
author: D. C.

description: Decent food for it's price. Customer service is pretty bad, the waitress don't pay enough attention to get the accessories you want even when asked. I hate the concert they always have on the T.V. Really slow service, but the best part about 2546 is the pan fried noodles(worth the long wait) and the location of this place.
author: Raymond S.

description:
I ordered beef stew ramen. 0 star for that. It smelled like swimming pool water, I couldn't drink the soup. That was some bad food.
5 stars for the hong kong style milk tea.
author: godzilla m.

description: I've been there to eat once before and the food was decent, but this time, I phoned in an order to go.  To my surprise, to go food doesn't come with the garlic bread or the soup, which you would get while dining in.  Thats fine.  So I ordered the Korean style ribs, Rockcod and Pork Chops.  The ribs weren't bad, but the other two were absolutely inedible.  The rockcod had about a pound of salt in it and the pork chop was like chewing on leather.  Definitely some meat that has been in the freezer for quite some time and borderline, rotten.  Needless to say, we're never going back to this place again.
author: Milton W.

description:
Made a last minute decision to eat here the other night as I ended up working alot later than anticipated, so instead of ordering to go, I figured  we can just come here and eat since it is right in our hood.  The little one had the spaghetti in meat sauce, which he really liked and the adults had the 3 dishes for $16.99 (I think it was $16.99) and we all thought the food was not bad.  We had the curry beef stew, tomato with beef, and king pao chicken.  The one thing that did not taste good was our drinks.  We ordered the lemon ice tea and all around thought that it was tasteless. 

Service was okay.  One thing we did not like was that they had to keep their front door open for circulation...on a cold evening, that is not so cool.  I was impressed to find that the restaurant was actually pretty clean.
