author: Stella C.

description:
Ask my girlfriend, there's been days that I've come out of this place more PISSED than I've been over anything in months.  

I moved to the Candlestick Cove condos about a year ago, and this spot off the San Bruno commercial strip is one of the closest places to get Chinese food.  The surrounding neighborhood at Candlestick is pretty pathetic in terms of food.  I started coming here since I noticed that other Chinese joints on San Bruno lack quality.  It is a somewhat blighted neighborhood with change coming slowly if at all.  2546 had a somewhere more modern appearance but it's nowhere near "nice" or "trendy."  I enjoyed the 3 item dinner special where for around $18 you get 3 dishes, soup, and rice.  The dishes themselves were a little greasy but not bad for the price.

Why I got pissed:  Coming home from work I stopped by to get some greasy Chinese comfort food and ordered braised rock cod with vegetables over rice to go.  I waited for the food, took it home, and opened the box to see deep fried rock cod with no sauce and no rice.  It was 100% fried fish, like something you see at Long John Silver's or something.  And NO RICE.  Bastards.  I didn't feel like driving back after the long day I had so I ate the fried fish.

The next week:  I ordered the same thing and pointed to the menu to make sure they knew I wanted the braised rock cod.  Maybe I should have looked in the box before I left, but again I was tired from work.  THEY FUCKED IT UP AGAIN.  Bastards..

So I had a hate hate relationship with this restaurant for awhile.  But overall it's not bad for the neighborhood and I like how it's close to my pad and I don't have to go all the way to the Richmond with it's terrible parking or to the Sunset with the fog and endless local traffic lights.  

Try it out if you're in the hood, but don't go out of the way for it.  ONE
author: Law C.

description:
My coworkers and I were lured in by the bright colors of their sign and food that looked promising (according to the posters on the wall.)   We weren't exactly greeted with warm smiles.  Their tables can't really seat more than 4 people so our party had to sit at 2 different tables.  Our waitress tossed our menus on the table and walked away (MINUS 1 STAR.)  It took quite awhile to flag down a waitress.  I ordered the tomato and beef pan fried noodles and my coworker had the satay beef with rice.  Once the food arrived,  I was shocked by the presentation.  It was literally pan fried noodles with a few pieces of beef and giant chunks of barely cooked tomato.  Some of the pieces of tomato had dirt on the peels... The only upside was the price.  $5 for a huge plate of noodles.  My coworker's Satay Beef with Rice wasn't terrible.  If i ever do go back, that's most likely what I'd order since the tea looked sketchy too =P

Bottom line,  poor service and unimpressive food for a cheap price....

The sign lied to me =(
author: E C.

description: i ordered a set breakfast.  the one that came with ramen.  and a few ants were swimming in the soup!  i'm never coming back here ever!
author: J K.

description:
This morning we want to this restaurant for special breakfast around 11:05, I order Rice wrap and soy milk ($4.25), the waitress said special breakfast order time have been pasted, but I can check for you. 
She came back and said still have one order left, so I order it and I ate a little bit, the waitress came back said no more soy milk and can not use milk tea to replace the soy milk but I still have to paid for the full price, what a business????? I felt that is ripped off. Never go back again !!!!!
author: Frankie L.

description:
Me and my friends go to this place at least 1-2 times a week. We love this place cuz the food is good and the price is good also. 

These people complain about the food not being that good and comparing it to elsewhere like chinatown. This place isn't the best but at the same time you can't ask for much more in a area like this. 

And for the people that complain about service... You get what you pay for. If you want good service go to a expensive fine dining restaurant.

You have to try this place out for yourself, I definitely recommend this place. Don't get fooled by the bad comment on yelp.
author: Cheng L.

description: We stumbled upon this restaurant when we happened to be in the area.  The menu and price looked innocent enough to draw us in.  My husband likes this place because it is cheap.  I don't care for the food as it was pretty tasteless and the place is really greasy and dirty.  I ordered plain white jook with pork and black egg since you really can't fail to make this dish.
author: Nanette L.

description: My mom saw a deal here so we can to eat here today for lunch with my aunt. Things here are cheap. You definitely get what you paid for. I felt the food was pretty good. What I didn't like was the service. It was bad service. They didn't great us with warm smiles, when they walked around see if there are empty plates to pick up they didn't bother asking how the food was. I would come here again for the food but only for take-outs. Otherwise I would rather go somewhere else for better service.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
The worst service I ever had.  I went there a year ago and had a bad expreience over there.  So, I stopped going there for a year.  After a year, I thought their service may improve a little bit.  However, it's still the same.  very disappointed.  

VERY BAD SERVICE!! They need to hire some better severs.
author: Eunice C.

description: Really tasty, and cleaner than most of the places on San Bruno Ave.  Try the catfish.
author: Nancy G.

description:
I tried both dinner and breakfast here and it is bad.  For breakfast, they have like 3 choices of the daily special for you to choose from, which is macaroni, ham and eggs, and porridge or rice noodles.  I'm not fond of breakfast item so I usually order chow fun kind of food instead.  But when I ask for that, they said they are strictly doing breakfast only.  I know it's breakfast hour but don't people know how to think outside the box?
For dinner, I've tried the baked pork chop rice and the salt pepper spareribs.  The baked pork chop rice doesn't taste or look like it's been in the oven.  What I received was a piece of pork chop next to some steam rice.  The salt and pepper spareribs was suppose to be deep fried until crispy, instead I got some pan fried pork chop soak in oil sprinkle with salt and pepper.  The bottom line is the food here sucks and it is nothing close to what you can get elsewhere.  The chef here just can't cook!
author: Heidi F.

description: We had two lunches to go and they were BAD.  I threw mine out (shrimp) and my coworker had something with eggplant which she said was foul and felt sick.  Worst chinese restaurant experience.  The place looks inviting, but you're much better off going to the dim sum place down the block (Hon something) or grabbing something from the New City Bakery across the street.
author: Catherine A.

description:
I came here 3 times. Meaning I gave them 2 chances to redeem themselves, but my rating just explains most of it in general. 

The price for the happy hour is NOT the cheapest, but far the highest price I have encountered.  Over 4 USD for happy hour food is not really cheap for happy hour.  Besides the price, the food is below average to poor.  The noodle I ordered, was horrid. Maybe others like baby food feel for the noodles, but I dont. The noodle was not like noodle, their all broken to pieces, like the left over noodles on the bottom of the basket.  For a note, I did not go there during closing hour, I went there during 4pm.  As for chicken wings w/ french fries, its not as it is named. It turned to 2x Chicken wings w/ 1x hash brown.The Chicken was actually fried well, but it is bland.  Seems like they just took it out of the package and threw it into the fryer.  No taste, only the taste of the oil they fried it with.  
Overall, 1 star. unless you like their milk tea, which is 'ok.'  But not enough to bump my score up higher than 1.  You gotta try to believe. You might like it, but not me.
author: Albert W.

description: sucky neighborhood.  decent menu.  most hong kong cafes actually offer more i think.  cheap eat.  we ate here after a volunteer stint across the street and was surprised at the fast service, good food, and cheap prices.  we went back to get take out and it took a bit longer than we expected.  and their food is kinda oily.
author: claudia y.

description: i love their curry chicken and i usually get their 3 items special. its good!! =D service was good, except for this one lady with a pony tail, she look pretty aggressive and doesn't seem to smile at customer. i don't really like their take out too much because they take forever and doesn't give rice!!
author: Valerie N.

description: I would normally give 2 stars to this restaurant, until I tried their breakfast menu.  Their chicken mushroom porridge is so good.  The porridge is not watery at all or too chunky.  The chicken and mushroom was soft and flavorful.  It also comes with a small order of chow fun.  Their breakfast comes with a drink as well.  All for only $3.05 or so.  What a deal.  As to dinner, it's not impressive.  The dinner menu is decent and worth going if you're in the neighborhood.  I would however not try any of the ramen stuff.  They have the chinese ramen where they would try to make it like chow mein, but I don't know what kind of ramen they use b/c it sucks.  As to the Japanese ramen in the soup noodle, that is really bland and the ramen is not even good.  The soup base sucks too.  Stick with the rice  stuff or baked spaghetti stuff.  Stick to basics.. and don't be too adventurous with the dinner stuff.  HOwever, I would have to say that their Ox-tail was surprisingly good.  It's like home-cooked, so it's not bad.  Their curry is so-so.  Their pork cutlet is not bad.
author: AhLin C.

description: When this restaurant FIRST opened, boy was it BAD.  I had to yell at the restaurant for being so slow.  My first experience there when it first opened was with my family.  We basically ordered food and they totally forgot about us.  We stayed there for 2 hours literally waiting...waiting.... FOREVER for our food.  The table behind us came like an hour after us and they were practically done eating.  We reminded them multiple times and they'd nod their head at us; supposedly reassuring us that our food would come soon.. did it come? NEVAH!  Then I started throwing some kinda fit, and they started rushing it out.  My mom says it's not the waiter's fault but more so the kitchen.. i GUESS... But that was way before. It's been opened for awhile now.  It's not super tasty but I don't mind ordering take out from there once in a while.  There's a deal where you can order 3 entrees + rice + soup(enough for a whole family dinner) for around all but $17.00?  Today my mom bought me the chicken string beans meal with rice.  Usually I love this entree but today it tastes a bit dry.  Perhaps they cooked it differently?  Something just tastes different.. If its gonna stay tasting like this,  I'll have to rethink this.
author: Leslie Y.

description: Okay, come on. I think everyone can agree that it's the best place to eat at on San Bruno Ave. Go for their breakfast menu - it's cheap and it's worth it. The place is small, HK style cafe, and it's a pretty comfortable place to eat at. I'd recommend it only if you were conveniently stuck in the Portola area, but don't drive all the way down here for it.
author: Judy L.

description: The food is alright, not too bad. But the service is horrible,
author: Max C.

description: i have my  worst service experience in 2546 cafe..... the food is ok to have 2-3 star. but the service ...no! i should say there is no service at all.....i live in this area for few months, go there for breakfast, lunch and dinner... but every time i go it make me up sad. i decide to not come back any more or go for food but just a penny for tip.
author: joey z.

description: we were walking by and needed food and this looked cheap. we went in and it WAS cheap. $15 for 3 people. there are specials before 5 and 530 pm. i had black bean chicken rice bowl, which was about $4. the sauce and veggies were good... the chicken was not. it was very fatty. i didnt finish it and j tried to finish it off. i warned him! he took one bite and pushed the plate away lol. b had a macaroni soup thingie which looked gross. he said it was ok. that was the most expensive ($6) and looked the cheapest. j had soup with rice noodles and dumplings, which looked good, and he said it was good, just that he was hungry after. it comes with your choice of tea (very strong milk tea) or coffee, and all for just under $4. the service was fine. the breakfast specials on the wall looked good. so... my food wasnt the best, but you get what you pay for, and it was sooo cheap. next time i'd get something else.
author: Merredith L.
